name: English Daisy
climate: English Daisies thrive in temperate climates with mild summers.
They prefer environments where temperatures are not too extreme.
These plants can tolerate cooler temperatures better than hot ones.
Regions with well-distributed rainfall are ideal for their growth.
sunlight: English Daisies flourish in full sunlight conditions when available.
They can tolerate partial shade but might not flower as profusely.
Direct sunlight for about six hours daily supports robust blooming.
Avoid deep shade as it can hinder their growth and flowering potential.
watering: Regular watering is essential, especially during dry spells to keep them blooming.
Ensure the soil stays consistently moist but not waterlogged to avoid root rot.
Water these plants at the base to prevent fungal diseases on leaves.
Reduce watering in cooler months as excessive moisture can harm the plant.
soil: Well-draining soil is crucial to prevent waterlogged roots and diseases.
Sandy loam with organic matter ensures optimal growth and nutrition.
English Daisies prefer soil with a slightly acidic to neutral pH level.
Ensure the soil structure allows for adequate aeration and root expansion.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading spent blooms encourages continuous flowering throughout the season.
Mulching around the base helps retain moisture and suppress weeds effectively.
Protect from heavy frost by covering or relocating them to sheltered spots.
Watch out for pest infestations like aphids and tackle them promptly.
